result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of  one year  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss the charge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse L. Noland

records.addlTxt:
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement
Copy Mailed to Defendant - 7-25-22

9:40 AM Defendant Jesse L. Noland in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Jesse L. Noland.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied.  Plea agreement recited into the record.  Amended information filed in 21CF17 - Attorney Laufenberg waives reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to Count 1 in 22CF1 and Counts 1 and  2 in 21CF17.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 -  21CF17 - Misd Battery.  Court makes a finding of guilt in 22CF1 and 21CF17 for count 1.  Statement by Attorney Fuhr. Statement by Attorney Laufenberg.   Court orders in count 2 - 21CF17 misd battery 30 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than August 20, 2022 at 4:30 pm  two days of sentence credit.; $300.00  inclusive of costs; DNA sample and surcharge  22CF1 and 21CF17 - Count 2 - Court defers entry of judgment for a period of one year with the standard conditions; no contact with C.J.J.O.  In Case 21CF17 -  Court orders $500.00 bond be forfeited and the remaining $500.00 be applied towards the fine and costs.  Court orders a new bond of $500.00 signature bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:15 PM Defendant Jesse L. Noland in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information to be filed.  Plea of not guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am. - rt
Granting DE's request to leave State of Wisconsin to Illionois to attend funeral
from DE to leave the State of Wisconsin to Illinois for funeral

09:37 AM Court report appeared via Zoom.  Defendant Jesse L. Noland in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg. ADA - Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  Bond continued.  Parties schedule Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing scheduled April 18, 2022 at 3:15 a.m. ba
Waiver of Prelim on April 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Initial appearance on February 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody.  Attorney Nick Smith appeared specially by phone. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties.   State requested a $2,000.00 signature bond with conditions of: booking; shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  DA requests for clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 21CF17.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for February 1, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.  Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 21CF17. ba

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court.  Must report to Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
